content.body: Private fields don't work on derived classes? Am I missing something?
Instance private fields work, static private fields only work if you access them using `ClassName.#priv` and not `this.#priv` (even from static methods)
content.formatted_body: Instance private fields work, static private fields only work if you access them using ClassName.#priv and not this.#priv (even from static methods)

content.body: nicolo-ribaudo: oh, maybe you can't declare them in the constructor? And I confused enclosing class with parent class, hmm
content.formatted_body: nicolo-ribaudo: oh, maybe you can't declare them in the constructor? And I confused enclosing class with parent class, hmm

content.body: You can only declare them outside of the constructor, using the fields syntax
If you want the inner class to have the same private fields as the outer one, that's not possible (even if you re-use the same name, it's a different "private key")
content.formatted_body: If you want the inner class to have the same private fields as the outer one, that's not possible (even if you re-use the same name, it's a different "private key")
